tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, desserts, eggs-dairy, fruit, easy, kid-friendly, frozen-desserts, nuts, dietary, toddler-friendly
steps: mix cream , milk , splenda , sugar , and vanilla into a large measuring cup, stir 1-2 minutes until sugar is dissolved, turn on ice cream machine and slowly pour in milk mixture, churn for 20-25 minutes, while ice cream is churning , prepare the pecans, in a small skillet , melt butter over medium heat, add pecans and salt, mix well and saute for 1-2 minutes until pecans have absorbed the butter and are nicely roasted, turn off heat and allow to cool, after the 20-25 minutes , when ice cream is almost done , add the pecan mixture and let churn for an additional 5 minutes, scoop out ice cream into a plastic container , cover and freeze for at least 2 hours, i love it served in a sugar cone
description: i created this semi-low calorie ice cream by combining my two favorites.... vanilla and butter pecan. note: recipe requires an ice cream maker.
ingredients: heavy cream, 2% low-fat milk, splenda sugar substitute, sugar, vanilla extract, light butter, pecans, kosher salt

name: homemade turkey breakfast sausage
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, breakfast, poultry, turkey, stove-top, dietary, spicy, meat, brunch, taste-mood, equipment
steps: lightly coat a 10-inch skillet with cooking oil spray and set aside, place 3 or 4 paper towles on a plate and set aside, in a medium bowl , combine onion , apples , egg white , oats , parsley and spices, add the ground turkey and mix well, shape mixture in eight 2-inch wide patties, preheat the skillet over medium heat, place patties in skillet and cook over medium heat for 10-12 minutes , turning once , until sausage is browned and completely done, transfer patties to paper-towel-lined plate to pat off excess grease, transfer to plates and enjoy with your pancakes or eggs
description: from outpost natural foods.  havent made it yet, but it looks really good and only 3 g fat per serving!
ingredients: onion, dried apples, egg white, quick-cooking oats, fresh parsley, salt, ground sage, pepper, nutmeg, red pepper, ground turkey

name: mixed berry sauce to be enjoyed with meat
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, sauces, condiments-etc, fruit, easy, beginner-cook, dinner-party, dietary, savory-sauces, egg-free, sweet-sauces, free-of-something, berries, meat, taste-mood, savory, sweet
steps: cook the meat that is going to be served in a pan and then remove it and set aside to rest , covering with foil to retain the heat, add the orange juice , bay leaf , redcurrant jelly , berries and sugar to the meat juices left in the pan from cooking the meat and boil the mixture for 3-4 minutes, lower the heat and simmer uncovered for another 5 minutes until the fruit is soft, remove the bay leaf , stir in the balsamic vinegar , mint and season with salt and pepper, spoon over the meat and serve immediately while hot
description: this is a sauce that my family and i enjoy eating with red meat, game or in particular, duck.  it was a bit of an experiment but turned out great.  the sauce itself takes only 10 minutes to make but it requires the juices from the meat so you have to cook your meat first.  please note: time cooking the meat will vary from meat to meat and person to person so i have not included this in cooking times, i have only included the timing of the actual sauce itself.  as it is a fruity sauce do not expect it to be thick and creamy, it is quite fluid but its the flavour that we love.  it is both sweet and savory atthe same time as the fruit and the meat juices used are a complete contrast to each other.
ingredients: orange, juice of, bay leaf, red currant jelly, mixed berries, of fresh mint, brown sugar, balsamic vinegar, juices from cooked meat

name: cheese stuffed anaheim peppers
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, appetizers, eggs-dairy, vegetables, easy, beginner-cook, cheese, dietary, low-carb, low-in-something, peppers, 4-hours-or-less
steps: cut stalk end of anaheim peppers and remove seeds, split small chili peppers , remove seeds and chop them finely, put cream cheese and feta cheese in bowl an combine well, season with pepper, add chopped chili peppers and herbs and mix well, stuff the peppers with the cheese mixture and chill for a few hours, when ready to serve , cut peppers into thin slices with a sharp knife and serve on a cracker as finger food
description: i found this delicious appetizer on another recipe site as i was looking for a way to use up the abundance of anaheim peppers i have growing in my garden. i brought this to a friends house and it was a big hit.  we used serrano peppers for the red and green hot chili peppers called for in the recipe and cilantro for the fresh herb.  we served atop baked pita chips.  prep time includes time to chill in fridge.
ingredients: anaheim chilies, hot red chili pepper, hot green chili pepper, cream cheese, feta cheese, fresh herb, fresh ground pepper

name: basil scented chicken salad
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, main-dish, salads, poultry, american, easy, no-cook, diabetic, picnic, spring, summer, chicken, dietary, seasonal, low-carb, low-in-something, meat, to-go, camping, presentation, served-cold, 3-steps-or-less, technique
steps: combine first five ingredients , stirring well, add chicken and next 4 ingredients , and toss gently, place spinach on individual serving plates, top with chicken mixture, sprinkle with pine nuts
description: this chicken salad sounds fresh as spring with fresh basil, spinach and parsley!  make this with a store bought rotisserie chicken and you have a super fast, no cook meal.  recipe from southern living® our best easy weeknight favorites.
ingredients: mayonnaise, lemon juice, dijon mustard, lemon-pepper seasoning, hot sauce, cooked chicken, fresh parsley, celery, fresh basil, green onions, fresh spinach, pine nuts

name: vegetable beef soup   slow cooker
tags: weeknight, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, healthy, soups-stews, beef, easy, fall, low-fat, winter, crock-pot-slow-cooker, dietary, low-cholesterol, seasonal, low-saturated-fat, low-calorie, comfort-food, low-carb, healthy-2, low-in-something, meat, taste-mood, equipment, 3-steps-or-less
steps: in a slow cooker , combine the first 12 ingredients, cover and cook on high for 6 hours, add vegetables , cover and cook for 2 hours longer or until meat and vegetables are tender
description: a hot soup for those chilly nights. a loaf of crusty bread to dunk in your bowl - oh yeah! this is winter comfort food at this house - especially after a day at the ski hill. sometimes i will throw some barley in for a change. try it - i think youll like it.
ingredients: stew meat, diced tomatoes, water, potatoes, onions, celery ribs, carrots, beef bouillon cubes, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, pepper, frozen mixed vegetables

name: lazy peach pie
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, low-protein, cobblers-and-crisps, pies-and-tarts, desserts, fruit, easy, vegetarian, pies, dietary, low-in-something, pitted-fruit, peaches
steps: preheat oven to 350, place butter in a 8" glass square pan and microwave until butter is melted, evenly distrubute melted butter on bottom of pan, in a small bowl , mix together sr flour , sugar , and milk and evenly pour over melted butter, place peach slices evenly over batter and pour reserved peach juice over peaches, combine cinnamon , nutmeg and brown sugar in a small bowl , and evenly sprinkle on top, bake in 350 degree oven about 30-45 minute or until brown
description: this is quick and easy.  great w/ some ice cream.  i havent made this for quite sometime, and my recipe is torn at the bottom, so i approximated the exact cooking time.  if you make this before i do again, please let me know if cook time is accurate.
ingredients: butter, self-rising flour, granulated sugar, milk, canned peaches, cinnamon, nutmeg, brown sugar

name: strawberry daze cocktail
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, cuisine, preparation, occasion, south-west-pacific, for-1-or-2, 5-ingredients-or-less, beverages, australian, easy, dinner-party, cocktails, food-processor-blender, equipment, small-appliance, number-of-servings, 3-steps-or-less
steps: blend all ingredients until smooth
description: im not really a big lover of tequila but in this drink i can handle it, found in a book picked up at a used book sale.
ingredients: cointreau liqueur, tequila, strawberry liqueur, orange juice, strawberries

name: peach cream pie
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, low-protein, pies-and-tarts, desserts, fruit, easy, pies, dietary, low-sodium, seasonal, low-in-something, 4-hours-or-less
steps: combine , sugar , butter , and flour, add beaten egg and vanilla, mix together, pour over peaches, pour into pie crust, bake in a 300 oven for 1 hour
description: my very best friend gave me this recipe. it is very good--looks a little strange, but dont let that fool you.
ingredients: sugar, butter, flour, egg, vanilla, peaches, pie crust

name: cheating lemon pound cake
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, occasion, 5-ingredients-or-less, desserts, oven, easy, potluck, kid-friendly, cakes, dietary, inexpensive, brunch, taste-mood, to-go, equipment, 3-steps-or-less
steps: in mixing bowl , beat cream cheese until smooth, gradually beat in milk, add dry cake mix and eggs, beat until combined, beat on medium speed for 2 minutes, pour into a greased and floured , 1- inch fluted tube pan, bake at 350f for 40 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out clean, cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan, cool completely on a wire rack
description: this is from a box mix, but with a little doctoring it does not taste like it.
ingredients: cream cheese, milk, lemon cake mix, eggs

name: clone kraft s catalina salad dressing
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, salads, american, easy, no-cook, refrigerator, beginner-cook, salad-dressings, dietary, inexpensive, equipment, number-of-servings, 3-steps-or-less, technique
steps: place all ingredients into blender and mix, store in jar in refrigerator, shake before using
description: this is the recipe i use as a substitute for krafts catalina dressing.
ingredients: sugar, salt, paprika, chili powder, celery seed, dry mustard, onion, vinegar, ketchup, vegetable oil

name: popeyes biscuits  copycat
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, occasion, 5-ingredients-or-less, breads, easy, rolls-biscuits, dietary, copycat, novelty
steps: mix bisquick and sour cream with pastry blender, stir in sprite, pat lightly on a floured surface, cut out biscuits and place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet at 400f for 10-12 minutes, brush with melted butter and enjoy
description: they taste just like the restaurant. fluffy and light and so easy to make.
ingredients: baking mix, light sour cream, sprite

name: spargelfest salad  grilled asparagus   beet salad w  honey m
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, lunch, salads, vegetables, german, european, dinner-party, holiday-event, asparagus
steps: preheat oven to 400f, combine vinegar , honey , mustard , lemon juice , shallots , salt and pepper in a small mixing bowl, slowly whisk in olive oil, line asparagus on baking sheet lined with parchment paper and brush with olive oil, roast for six minutes, line four salad plates with european salad mix , divide beets among salads , attractively roll and arrange ham / prosciutto over salads , top each salad with five spears of grilled asparagus and sprinkle with 2 oz, cambozola and pine nuts, stir vinaigrette and adjust seasoning if desired, drizzle over salads, butter toasted bread, cut each slice in half and then in half diagonally to form two triangles, sprinkle with remaining 4 oz, cambozola and place in hot oven just to soften and warm cheese, place four triangles around each salad and serve
description: wonderful german salad that is perfect for a light summer dinner or as a starter to a meal. healthy and tasty! try to use german condiments when preparing this salad for a more authentic salad. wine: franz karl schmitt riesling spätlese rheinhessen niersteiner hipping 2001 from germany is a perfect match! guten appetit!
ingredients: asparagus spears, olive oil, vinegar, honey, sweet mustard, fresh lemon juice, shallots, salt and pepper, mixed salad greens, red beets, ham, cambozola cheese, pine nuts, bread, butter

name: edamame rice bowls
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, side-dishes, beans, easy, beginner-cook, soy-tofu, 3-steps-or-less
steps: bring 1 1 / 4 cups water to a boil , stir in rice and season with salt, cover , reduce heat to medium low and simmer 45 minutes or until rice is tender, bring 2 cups salted water to a boil , add edamame and cook 2 minutes or until tender, drain and set aside, toss together rice , edamame , cranberries , feta , olives , cilantro , oil , lime juice and red pepper flakes in a large bowl, season with salt and pepper
description: wonderful flavors blended together in this brown rice dish.  i found this in the "healing foods" march edition.
ingredients: brown rice, edamame, dried cranberries, feta cheese, kalamata olives, cilantro, olive oil, lime juice, red pepper flakes

name: aromatic pumpkin chili
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, healthy, main-dish, beans, easy, low-fat, chili, dietary, spicy, low-cholesterol, low-saturated-fat, low-calorie, comfort-food, black-beans, chick-peas-garbanzos, healthy-2, low-in-something, meat, taste-mood, sweet, 3-steps-or-less, 4-hours-or-less
steps: brown meat and onion together, add meat and onion to large pot with black beans after they have finished soaking and have been drained and rinsed, add remaining ingredients except cilantro, cover and simmer for 2-3 hours on low heat , maintain a light bubbling and simmer until black beans are soft, stir occasionally, adjust the seasonings to your liking, garnish with cilantro and serve with tortilla chips
description: this recipe came about because i was craving a "different" kind of chili.  pumpkin immediately came to my mind.  the smell that filled my house while simmering was amazing!  this chili was thick and creamy, not much color but delicious!
ingredients: garbanzo beans, dried black beans, "libbys canned pumpkin", green chilies, reduced-sodium chicken broth, diced tomatoes, bison meat, onion, garlic powder, cumin, chili powder, cayenne, nutmeg, salt, cinnamon, cinnamon stick, cilantro

name: zucchini pomodoro
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, main-dish, side-dishes, vegetables, easy, vegan, vegetarian, dietary, squash
steps: saute onions , red pepper , garlic , and celery in a few t of water , veggie broth or balsamic vinegar for a few minutes , until tender, add tumeric , ginger , cumin and zucchini, cook over medium heat for 5 minutes, add tomato sauce , peas and cayenne pepper and cook until zucchini is tender , about 15 minutes, can be a main dish on its own or serve over pasta or rice
description: spicy savory zucchini.  from healing heart foundation.
ingredients: red onion, red bell pepper, garlic cloves, celery, turmeric, gingerroot, cumin powder, zucchini, tomato sauce, frozen peas, cayenne pepper

name: cabbage non rolls  casserole
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, healthy, casseroles, main-dish, pork, poultry, rice, canadian, oven, easy, beginner-cook, potluck, fall, winter, turkey, dietary, one-dish-meal, gluten-free, low-cholesterol, seasonal, low-calorie, comfort-food, low-carb, inexpensive, healthy-2, ontario, free-of-something, low-in-something, meat, pasta-rice-and-grains, white-rice, taste-mood, to-go, equipment, 4-hours-or-less
steps: preheat the oven to 350f, mix the seasonings in a small bowl and set aside, peel and chop the onion , peel and grate the carrot , and chop the celery, break up the meat and cook it in a skillet until browned through, if it is very lean , you may need to add a little oil, add the onion , carrot and celery after it has cooked for a few minutes, when the meat is browned and the vegetables softened , add the spices and mix them in, let cook just until the garlic is fragrant, remove the meat mixture to a very large lasagne pan or shallow casserole, mix in the chopped cabbage , sauerkraut , rice and tomatoes, spread evenly in the pan, add the water, it should come up to near the top of the mixture, cover the pan with foil, bake at 350f for one hour, stirring once in the middle
description: much quicker and easier than making cabbage rolls, but just as delicious.
ingredients: garlic, salt, black pepper, sweet hungarian paprika, ground cumin, fennel seed, ground lean pork, onion, carrot, celery, cabbage, sauerkraut, rice, crushed tomatoes, water

name: vegetarian eggplant lasagna
tags: time-to-make, main-ingredient, preparation, pasta, easy, vegetarian, lasagna, dietary, pasta-rice-and-grains, 4-hours-or-less
steps: slice eggplant in 1 / 4" slice , spray with pam on both sides and broil both sides in batches till soft and brown , set aside, put oven to bake at 350f, in large lasagna pan layer as follows:, 1 / 3 spaghetti sauce, 1 / 3 lasagna sheets, 1 / 3 spaghetti sauce, 1 / 2 the eggplant, 1 / 2 the mozzarella, 1 / 3 lasagne sheets, remaining spaghetti sauce, chopped red peppers, remaining lasagna sheets, remaining eggplant, spread pesto over top layer of eggplant, make white sauce as follows ,, melt butter in saucepan , add flour cook for 2 minutes, whisk in milk and whisk until thickened, whisk grated cheese in and stir until smooth, pour white sauce over casserole and bake 30 minutes until bubbly and heated through
description: vegetarian or not, youve got to try this one!  i have even converted eggplant haters with this!  it is so good! very forgiving too you can make ahead partially or completely and freeze or hold in fridge a day or until needed.  enjoy!
ingredients: eggplants, roasted red peppers, spaghetti sauce, no-boil lasagna noodles, mozzarella cheese, pesto sauce, pecorino romano cheese, butter, flour, milk

name: sour cream hash browns bake
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, side-dishes, eggs-dairy, potatoes, vegetables, oven, easy, beginner-cook, dinner-party, holiday-event, kid-friendly, cheese, stove-top, dietary, christmas, taste-mood, savory, equipment
steps: set oven to 350 degrees, butter a 13 x 9-inch baking dish, in a skillet saute the yellow onion , green onion , garlic and celery in 1 / 4 cup butter for about 3-4 minutes or until softened, transfer to a large bowl, add in soup , hash brown potatoes , parmesan cheese , sour cream , cheddar cheese and mayo, mix well with a wooden spoon to combine , then season with seasoned salt and black pepper, transfer the mixture to prepared baking dish, top with grated parmesan cheese, bake for about 40 minutes
description: if desired add in 1-2 jalapeno peppers seeded and chopped with the onions and garlic, i also sometimes add in cooked crumbled bacon or cooked browned sausage meat too, but that is optional, you can also make this using cold cooked finely diced potatoes in place of the hash browns, or tater tots, this is a really great potato casserole, i make it often it is a family favorite!
ingredients: onion, green onions, garlic, celery, butter, frozen hash brown potatoes, cream of chicken soup, parmesan cheese, sour cream, old cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, seasoning salt, black pepper

name: easiest chicken pot pie
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, savory-pies, main-dish, poultry, easy, kid-friendly, chicken, turkey, dietary, one-dish-meal, comfort-food, meat, taste-mood
steps: preheat oven to 375 degrees, cut chicken into small cubes, in large pot mix vegetables , soups , butter and chicken, cook on medium heat for 10 minutes, put soup mixture in 10 x 13 inch baking dish, unroll cresent rolls and cover mixture with unrolled cresents, bake for 20 minutes or until cresent cover is golden brown, let cool pie cool down for about 5 minutes before serving
description: great on a cold night when you want comfort food!
ingredients: mixed vegetables, cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, cooked chicken breasts, crescent rolls, butter

name: swiss carrot cake with mascarpone icing
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, desserts, vegetables, easy, cakes, carrots, 4-hours-or-less
steps: combine carrots , almonds , breadcrumbs , spices & baking powder in a bowl, beat egg yolks until thick , gradually adding sugar , lemon rind and juice , beat until thick, stir egg yolk mixture into carrot mixture, beat egg whites until stiff , then fold gently into carrot mixture, grease 20cm cake tin, pour batter into cake tin , and bake in a moderate oven for about an hour , cake tester should come out clean, cool in tin for 10min then turn out on a wire rack to cool completely, to make icing place butter , cheese and icing sugar in a food processor and beat until smooth, spread over cooled cake
description: lighter more citrus version of old favorite
ingredients: almonds, carrot, dry breadcrumbs, ginger, cinnamon, mace, baking powder, eggs, sugar, lemon rind, lemon juice, butter, mascarpone cheese, icing sugar

name: plain dumplings  spatzen
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, cuisine, preparation, healthy, 5-ingredients-or-less, breads, scandinavian, easy, european, low-fat, swedish, dietary, low-saturated-fat, low-in-something
steps: beat egg well , add salt and water or milk and stir this into the flour until a smooth batter is formed, drop by spoonfuls into boiling , salted water and let cook 15 minutes, drain in a colander, pour hot fat or meat gravy over them and serve, garnish with fried onions , cracker crumbs , or any desired dressing
description: this recipe came from my grandmother, margaret h.  it has been passed down in our family from our ancestors in sweden.  i grew up thinking this was what everyone called "dumplings."  i usually put them in chicken soup instead of pouring hot fat over them!
ingredients: flour, salt, water, egg

name: chicken saag
tags: curries, weeknight, 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, main-dish, poultry, vegetables, asian, indian, easy, dinner-party, chicken, food-processor-blender, spicy, meat, chicken-breasts, chicken-thighs-legs, greens, spinach, taste-mood, equipment, small-appliance, presentation, served-hot, 3-steps-or-less
steps: puree everything but the last four recipe items in a food processor, heat oil in a large skillet or medium saucepan, saute the bay leaves for a couple minutes, add the spinach puree and the chicken, simmer until chicken is tender 30-60 minutes, add cream or yogurt , heat through, add some water or milk if spinach seems too dry, serve when hot
description: i had been a big fan of saag paneer before i tried this recipe, and so i was anxious to try a spinach curry with meat. the results turned out very tasty.
ingredients: frozen spinach, onion, fresh gingerroot, garlic cloves, fresh green chile, black peppercorns, tomatoes, curry powder, cayenne pepper, vegetable oil, bay leaves, chicken, cream

name: grilled cuban sandwich
tags: weeknight, 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, lunch, caribbean, cuban, sandwiches, meat, to-go, camping
steps: in a small bowl , combine olive oil , mustard , cumin , paprika and a pinch of salt, spread mixture on bread, on four slices , layer ingredients in this order: cheese , ham , turkey , then pickles, top with remaining four slices of bread to form sandwiches , pressing down to compress filling, heat a large skillet , panini press or sandwich maker to medium-high heat, spread butter on bottom of each sandwich and place buttered side down on hot surface, butter top side of sandwich while in pan and grill until browned, flip sandwich and grill on other side, if using a panini or sandwich press , close press, grill , pressing constantly , until sandwiches are browned and crisp on both sides and cheese is melted , about 10 -12 minutes
description: a wonderful combo.  should you have roast pork, throw that on, too.
ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, yellow mustard, ground cumin, smoked paprika, bread, black forest ham, turkey, swiss cheese, dill pickles, butter

name: abby s oriental yum yum soup
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, clear-soups, soups-stews, seafood, vegetables, asian, easy, european, beginner-cook, dinner-party, winter, spicy, seasonal, inexpensive, pasta-rice-and-grains, taste-mood, 4-hours-or-less
steps: in a heavy based pan put prawns , chicken and all the veg, stir fry for 5 minutes in cooking oil, add ginger and continue to stir fry for 2 minutes, add liquid stocks and water , stir, add sesame oil and soy sauce , salt and pepper, stir well , bring to the boil and gently simmer for 10 minutes, add egg noodles and simmer for another 30 minutes , stirring every 5 minutes, "dont let this soup boil", wala enjoy1
description: an extremely tasty soup, full of veg and seafood. i havent met anyone who doesnt say oh my god! when they taste it.
ingredients: king prawns, chicken breast fillet, celery, spring onions, mushrooms, cabbage, ginger, sesame oil, soy sauce, vegetable stock, chicken consomme, water, vermicelli, salt, pepper, oil

name: curly noodle pork supper
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, lunch, main-dish, pork, american, easy, beginner-cook, potluck, kid-friendly, stove-top, dietary, one-dish-meal, stir-fry, comfort-food, inexpensive, meat, taste-mood, to-go, equipment, technique
steps: in a large skillet , cook pork , red pepper , broccoli , and onions in oil until meat is no longer pink, add the water , noodles with contents of seasoning packets , parsley and soy sauce, bring to a boil, reduce heat, cook for 3- 4 minutes or until noodles are tender
description: this is an enocomical meal that can also utilize chicken or beef. depending on what is on sale at the grocery store. i love the noodles, vegetables, and flavoring the noodle packets give the meat. 5 w.w. points per serving
ingredients: pork tenderloin, sweet red pepper, broccoli floret, green onions, vegetable oil, water, pork-flavored ramen noodles, fresh parsley, soy sauce

name: italian polenta casserole
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, main-dish, pork, vegetables, oven, european, dinner-party, italian, stove-top, comfort-food, meat, pork-sausage, brunch, taste-mood, equipment, 4-hours-or-less
steps: in 5- to 6-quart dutch oven , cook sausage and ground beef on medium-high 5 to 6 minutes or until browned , stirring and breaking up meat with side of spoon, with slotted spoon , transfer meat mixture to medium bowl, to same dutch oven , add onion, cook on medium 8 to 10 minutes or until tender, stir in garlic, cook 30 seconds, add tomatoes with their puree, heat to boiling on high , breaking up tomatoes with side of spoon, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer , uncovered , 10 minutes, add eggplant and meat, cover and cook 5 minutes on medium, uncover and cook 10 minutes longer or until eggplant is tender , stirring occasionally, meanwhile , preheat oven to 400 degrees f, in microwave-safe 4-quart bowl , with wire whisk , combine water , broth , cornmeal , and salt, microwave on high 15 to 20 minutes or until cornmeal mixture is very thick, after first 5 minutes of cooking , whisk vigorously until smooth, whisk 2 more times during remaining cooking time, remove from microwave , whisk in romano, spoon 2 cups hot polenta into each of two 1 1 / 2-quart shallow casseroles, spread polenta over bottom and up sides of casseroles, spoon filling over polenta, spread remaining polenta around casserole edge to form a rim, sprinkle with a couple tablespoons additional grated romano , parmesan , or asiago, bake one casserole 30 minutes or until hot, let stand 10 minutes for easier serving, makes 8 servings, "make sure to use quality sausage - ive used my favorite , our freshly made merguez , and good sausage really makes a difference"
description: based on a recipe from good housekeeping. this italian casserole delivers comfort with creamy polenta and a hearty tomato ragu studded with spicy sausage and eggplant.
ingredients: hot italian sausage, lean ground beef, onions, garlic cloves, tomatoes in puree, eggplant, water, chicken broth, cornmeal, salt, pecorino romano cheese

name: easy crunchy apple crisp
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, low-protein, healthy, cobblers-and-crisps, desserts, fruit, fall, winter, dietary, low-sodium, seasonal, comfort-food, inexpensive, low-in-something, apples, taste-mood
steps: spray an 8x8 pan with cooking spray , then place the sliced apples in the pan, mix the sugar , 2 teaspoons flour and cinnamon together , sprinkle over apples, pour the water over the apple mixture, combine the oats , remaining flour , brown sugar , baking powder and baking soda together, stir in the melted butter and crumble over the apples, bake at 350 for 40-45 minute, serve warm with icecream or caramel sauce
description: 700 five star reviews convinced me to try this dessert. ive tried many apple crisp recipes, and this will be the keeper. the apples are moist and the topping is crunchy, just the way it was meant to be. found on allrecipes.
ingredients: sliced apples, white sugar, flour, cinnamon, water, quick-cooking oats, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, butter

name: dude ranch soup
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, soups-stews, beans, beef, easy, crock-pot-slow-cooker, meat, steaks, equipment, 3-steps-or-less
steps: add all ingredients except cheese to the slow cooker crock and mix well, cover and cook on low for 7 1 / 2 hours, stir in cheddar cheese and cook 1 / 2 hour more
description: taken from the everyday low-carb slow cooker cookbook.
ingredients: round steaks, red kidney beans, green chilies, celery ribs, beef broth, tomato paste, chili powder, adobo seasoning, beef bouillon cube, black pepper, cumin, garlic, instant minced onion, low-fat cheddar cheese

name: nif s grandpa s baked granola
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, north-american, granola-and-porridge, breakfast, condiments-etc, fruit, canadian, oven, easy, beginner-cook, kid-friendly, vegetarian, nuts, grains, dietary, low-sodium, low-in-something, coconut, pasta-rice-and-grains, equipment, 3-steps-or-less
steps: mix dry ingredients in a large bowl, mix wet mixture ingredients together in a medium bowl, add wet mixture to dry, mix until small clusters form, if you live in a dry area , you may need to add more water - add 1 / 4 cup more at a time, spread very evenly onto 2 cookie sheets, bake for 30 - 35 minutes at 350f bake in 9-10 minute intervals , then mix on the pan, "make sure that it is evenly distributed so corner areas dont burn", you can enjoy some of it warm but cool completely to store in an airtight container
description: when i was a little girl, my grandma would make batches of this for my grandpa. it filled her house with a wonderful aroma and tasted terrific. she would store it in large glass mason jars when it cooled. this is a half batch of what she used to make and my sister makes this amount fresh every week. you can eat this as regular granola with milk or sprinkle on yogourt or ice cream. thanks grandma! enjoy!
ingredients: whole oats, slivered almonds, wheat germ, unsweetened coconut, oil, brown sugar, vanilla, water

name: mexican skillet
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, main-dish, beef, rice, american, mexican, southwestern-united-states, dietary, spicy, one-dish-meal, inexpensive, ground-beef, meat, pasta-rice-and-grains, long-grain-rice, taste-mood
steps: brown ground beef , onion , green pepper and garlic, season with the chili powder , garlic and salt / pepper, add diced tomatoes and pinto beans, simmer for 10 minutes, stir in cooked rice, serve and enjoy
description: this is a quick and delicious dish
ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, garlic clove, chili powder, garlic powder, salt and pepper, diced tomatoes, pinto beans, cooked long-grain rice, cayenne pepper, chilies

name: my family favourite chocolate cake
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, desserts, oven, easy, beginner-cook, cakes, oamc-freezer-make-ahead, inexpensive, equipment, number-of-servings, presentation, served-cold
steps: cream the margarine and the sugar until light and fluffy, "i personally prefer to lessen the amount of sugar as i dont like things overly sweet but 80z is the original recipe", whisk the eggs into the sugar / margarine mixture, slowly add the flour , baking powder and cocoa, sieve these to avoid lumps, stir in a figure of 8 fashion, gradually add enough water to loosen the cake mix up a bit, it should be the consistency of a slightly thin custard, pour into a non stick cake tin , preferably with loose bottom, "i use an 8 round tin for this cake", bake on a middle / top shelf in the oven at 180 c for around 45 mins or until a skewer comes out clean, remove from tin and cool on wire rack, once cooled , top with chocolate icing , frosting etc or dust with icing sugar and cocoa powder
description: a super light and fluffy chocolate sponge cake.
ingredients: self raising flour, margarine, sugar, eggs, baking powder, cocoa powder, water

name: sernik polish cheesecake
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, for-large-groups, desserts, eggs-dairy, oven, european, dinner-party, holiday-event, easter, polish, cheesecake, cheese, eggs, food-processor-blender, christmas, equipment, small-appliance, mixer, number-of-servings, 4-hours-or-less, from-scratch
steps: preheat oven to 350 degrees, dough:, pulse flour , baking powder , sugar , and salt in a food processor and butter and pulse till crumbly, add egg and sour cream mix till it comes to a ball, with heavy floured hands press into a 13x9x2 pan bring up a touch on the sides of the pan, it will be sticky, filling:, beat egg whites in a mixer till stiff , set aside, beat egg yolks , sugar and vanilla till light and creamy, in a food processor place butter , potatoes , cheese , grand marnier or limoncello , nutmeg , salt and zest of lemon or orange pulse till all combined, add to yolk mixture folding in to incorporate, fold in beaten egg whites, pour on to crust, bake for 45-50 minutes, turn oven off and let cool with door ajar, cool well before serving
description: a polish cheesecake that i grew up on using modern technology, mixer and food processor. farmers cheese is the choice of cheese but ricotta is just as good. this is rich using eggs, cream and cheese. i flavored with liqueurs using any lemon or orange flavored ones you enjoy.
ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, unsalted butter, egg, sour cream, eggs, vanilla extract, mashed potatoes, farmer cheese, grand marnier, nutmeg, orange zest

name: dry aged steak at home
tags: weeknight, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, for-1-or-2, 5-ingredients-or-less, main-dish, beef, american, easy, dinner-party, meat, steak, number-of-servings
steps: on a plate sprinkle salt evenly on both sides of steak-you can use up to 1 teaspoon if the steak is really large, let steak sit on the plate for 45 minutes , then flip and repeat time, i do this at room temperature, you will notice that the steak will weep then suck the fluid back inches, this seasons them and tenderizes them, once done with the salt / plate process i place my steak on a rack over a cookie sheet to air dry, do not cover, you can place them in the fridge , however you will need to pull them back out 1 hour before you grill, allow steak to "age" for 3 1 / 2 hours , up to 5 hours, i do not place my steak in the fridge , i simply place the rack in the oven to age, our house is cool so if your house is hot , i would place in fridge , pulling steak out one hour before you grill
description: through some trial and error i have hit on a pretty good recipe for dry aged steak at home.  this is a 1 day method, recipe instructions for one steak.
ingredients: rib eye steak, coarse sea salt

name: italian herbed grilled chicken
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, main-dish, salads, poultry, easy, chicken, dietary, inexpensive, meat, chicken-breasts
steps: mix mayo and seasonings, one hour before grill time , brush both sides of each breast with about half of mixture & return to refrigerator, grill for 6-9 minutes each side generously coating each side with mixture, we usually grill 4 minutes , brush & flip then 4 minutes two times each side -- if that makes any sense, great on ciabatta bread as a sammie , try over rice and even the left overs are great sliced up on a salad
description: for the grill.  mix in the morning or even the night before.  very tender and juicy chicken breasts.
ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, italian dressing, oregano, lemon pepper, garlic powder, mayonnaise

name: the best marinade ever
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, low-protein, condiments-etc, easy, marinades-and-rubs, dietary, low-sodium, low-carb, low-in-something
steps: mix all ingredients together, place the fish or meat in the marinade, turn the pieces over several times, keep refrigerated, fish should be marinated for 45 minutes , chicken for at least an hour , and red meats like lamb for several hours, when the fish or meat has marinated long enough , heat up your grill , pull the pieces out of the marinade , and season them well with salt and pepper, immediately place on the grill, baste occasionally with the leftover marinade, discard marinade when grilling is complete
description: the title says it all.  this is enough for 4 tuna steaks, lamb chops or chicken pieces.  from chris mcferran of best cellars, a wine store based in nyc.
ingredients: orange juice, pure olive oil, fresh ginger, garlic cloves, fresh basil leaf, of fresh mint, fresh ground pepper

name: scottish raspberry buns
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, for-large-groups, breads, eggs-dairy, fruit, oven, european, potluck, dinner-party, finger-food, heirloom-historical, holiday-event, kid-friendly, picnic, scottish, eggs, dietary, gifts, christmas, comfort-food, oamc-freezer-make-ahead, brown-bag, valentines-day, inexpensive, quick-breads, berries, raspberries, taste-mood, to-go, equipment, number-of-servings, presentation
steps: set oven to 425f or mark 7, grease and flour baking sheets, sift the flour into a bowl and rub in the margarine, add the sugar and the beaten egg with enough milk to make a fairly stiff consistency, divide the mixture into about walnut-size balls and place on baking sheet , allowing space for them to spread slightly during cooking, make a small hole in the centre of each bal1 and spoon in a little raspberry jam, pinch the edges together again, dust lightly with caster sugar, bake for 10 minutes then reduce heat to 350f or mark 4 and bake for a further 5 minutes, the buns should be light golden in colour, cool on a wire rack, store in an airtight container at room temperature
description: i am dedicating this delicious recipe to barb talkington, barbara mooers, diana neal, and lennie, without whose advice and guidance i would never have been able to make them properly!
ingredients: self-raising flour, margarine, caster sugar, egg, milk, raspberry jam

name: chocolate cherry cordial bars
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, desserts, lunch, fruit, oven, easy, beginner-cook, potluck, dinner-party, finger-food, holiday-event, kid-friendly, picnic, romantic, vegetarian, cakes, cookies-and-brownies, chocolate, bar-cookies, dietary, gifts, christmas, hanukkah, comfort-food, valentines-day, taste-mood, to-go, equipment, number-of-servings, presentation
steps: preheat oven to 350, grease a 10 x 15 pan, combine butter , eggs , sugars and extracts in a large bowl and beat at medium until well blended, combine flour , soda and cinnamon and mix into creamed mixture until just blended, stir in pie filling and chocolate chips, spread in pan, bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned, cool completely in pan on wire rack, "sprinkle with confectioners sugar or drizzle with melted chocolate , if desired", cut into 2 1 / 2 x 2 inch bars
description: these bars are the ultimate treat. with chocolate and cherries you cant go wrong (in my opinion :).
ingredients: butter, eggs, granulated sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, almond extract, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, cherry pie filling, milk chocolate chips

name: turkish poached eggs with yogurt and spicy sage butter
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, breakfast, lunch, eggs-dairy, easy, eggs, dietary, inexpensive, brunch
steps: stir yogurt and garlic in small bowl to blend and then season to taste with salt, divide the mixture equally among 4 plates , spreading to coat the the center of each plate, melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat , then add the sage , paprika and red pepper and stir just until the butter sizzles, remove from heat and season with salt, add the vinegar to large skillet of simmering water and return the mixture to a simmer, crack the eggs into the simmering water and simmer until the eggs are softly cooked , about 3 minutes, using a slotted spoon or pasta server / fork , remove the eggs from the water , drain briefly and place 2 eggs atop the yogurt on each plate, rewarm the butter mixture , if necessary , and spoon over the eggs, serve immediately with pita bread
description: a delightful breakfast/brunch recipe from bon appetit, may 1995
ingredients: plain yogurt, garlic cloves, unsalted butter, fresh sage leaves, paprika, dry crushed red pepper, distilled white vinegar, eggs, pita bread

name: ww tomato soup
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, soups-stews, vegetables, easy, vegan, vegetarian, dietary, tomatoes, 3-steps-or-less
steps: spray a saucepan with the low-fat spray, gently cook the onion , pepper , mushrooms and garlic to soften, add the remaining ingredients , bring to a boil and simnmer for 15 minutes
description: 1 point-very good and very easy to make..also very filling.  the longer you cook it the better it is.  thanks to weight watchers...they suggest using "dried herbs."  i used 1 t oregano, 1t basil and 1t parsley.
ingredients: onions, water, chopped tomatoes, yellow peppers, dried herbs, mushrooms, salt and pepper, garlic clove, low-fat cooking spray

name: amish noodles
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, healthy, 5-ingredients-or-less, side-dishes, eggs-dairy, american, easy, holiday-event, eggs, dietary, christmas, thanksgiving, comfort-food, amish-mennonite, inexpensive, northeastern-united-states, pasta-rice-and-grains, taste-mood
steps: place flour in bowl , make well in center , add the rest of the ingredients and stir with fork until it combines and ball forms, turn out on kneading board dusted with bread flour and knead for 5 minutes, cover dough with towel and let it rest 45 minutes, cut the dough into quarters, roll out one fourth into a rectangle 8"x14" , until almost paper thin , flour on both sides and set aside, roll out the other three sections , stack them together and let them set for 30 minutes, roll them up like a jelly roll , starting with shortest side and using a very sharp knife , cut them the width you prefer, if there is any moisture add a little more flour, unroll the circles , separate them and let them dry , hours if necessary, cook in broth for 5 to 7 minutes
description: this is my dads favorite noodle recipe. he makes them for thanksgiving and christmas every year. cooking time is actually the drying time. these can be frozen in zippy bags and used, as needed.
ingredients: bread flour, salt, eggs, vegetable oil, water

name: banana cereal for daniel fast
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, for-1-or-2, breakfast, fruit, easy, number-of-servings, 3-steps-or-less
steps: place all ingredients into a bowl, pour milk on top
description: a great breakfast for the daniel fast
ingredients: banana, blueberries, almonds, apricot, dried dates, fig, unsweetened flaked coconut

name: red cabbage with apples and spices   crock pot
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, low-protein, healthy, side-dishes, fruit, vegetables, fall, low-fat, vegetarian, crock-pot-slow-cooker, dietary, low-sodium, low-cholesterol, seasonal, low-saturated-fat, low-calorie, low-carb, healthy-2, low-in-something, apples, taste-mood, sweet, equipment, presentation, served-hot
steps: place all ingredients into a large crock pot, it will be full but will cook down to about 1 / 5, cook for 5 hours on low, stirring occasionally adding water if needed, optional: or you can cook stove top saute onions in some butter till softened add rest of ingredients and simmer 1-2 hours or bake at 350 degrees
description: you can braise this on the stove top as well in the crock pot! this is a long cooking recipe to make a very tender texture. the braised red cabbage of alsace, counterbalances the fattiness making pork, duck or a traditional christmas goose a great to serve with it. seasoned with apples, ginger, cinnamon, coriander and nutmeg. try even some lavender in it!
ingredients: red cabbage, red onion, apple cider, granny smith apple, balsamic vinegar, honey, salt and pepper, ginger, cinnamon, ground coriander, ground nutmeg

name: amazing apple cider
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, beverages, fruit, american, easy, beginner-cook, fall, holiday-event, kid-friendly, winter, dietary, seasonal, inexpensive, free-of-something, toddler-friendly, apples
steps: sprinkle cinnamon and sugar on both sides of apple slices, in a deep pot , saute apples with more cinnamon and sugar, add juice , water , vanilla , honey , and more cinnamon if desired, bring to a boil , stirring occasionally, reduce to medium heat and simmer until apple slices are incredibly tender, remove from heat and strain, stir in sugar crystals , to taste and serve immediately
description: this recipe is amazing. i created it myself, and this way you can get hot, authentic cider using real apples. plus, you only use real apples, and only one pan is needed! i hope you enjoy!
ingredients: apples, juice, boiling water, cinnamon, sugar crystals, vanilla extract, honey

name: butterscotch banana pudding
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, low-protein, healthy, pies-and-tarts, desserts, easy, beginner-cook, pies, puddings-and-mousses, dietary, inexpensive, low-in-something
steps: preheat oven to 180 c / 350f, combine brown sugar , golden syrup and boiling water in a put, bring to a boil for about 2- 3 minutes, set aside, sift flour , sugar , baking powder and salt into a bowl, add beaten egg , melted butter , vanilla extra and mashed banana, pour combined mixture into greased casserole dish, then very slowly , pour brown sugar / golden syrup over what is in the casserole dish, bake uncovered 30-40 minutes, enjoy !, can serve with you favourite ice cream !
description:
like a cake, but lighter, true!
not the most ordinary of puddings too!
love the taste, curiosity will get you!
look forward to the first review!
ingredients: flour, salt, caster sugar, baking powder, butter, egg, banana, vanilla extract, brown sugar, golden syrup, boiling water

name: zoolbia
tags: time-to-make, cuisine, preparation, 5-ingredients-or-less, asian, middle-eastern, iranian-persian, easy, 4-hours-or-less
steps: mix starch , 1-2 spoons of sugar , and water , then add yogurt and mix well until the mixture is even and smooth, heat oil in a pan until hot, pour the mix through a funnel into the pan creating round lattice shapes about 5-6 cm in diameter, turn heat down and fry fully on one side , then on the other, mix well sugar , rose-water , and a glass of water, heat until water comes to a boil , and the syrup thickens, remove from heat, soak zoolbia in the syrup for about 5 minutes , then serve
description: persian/iranian dessert
ingredients: starch, yogurt, sugar, cooking oil, rose water

name: banana pudding pie
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, pies-and-tarts, desserts, fruit, american, southern-united-states, dinner-party, holiday-event, puddings-and-mousses, dietary, low-sodium, low-in-something, tropical-fruit, bananas
steps: reserve 30 vanilla wafers, coarsely crush the remaining wafers in a food processor, combine with the butter until blended, firmly press the crumbs from the bottom of a 9" pie plate all the way to the outer edge of the plate, bake at 350f for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned, cool on a wire rack for 30 minutes, when completely cool , arrange banana slices in the crust, vanilla cream filling: in a saucepan , combine the 3 / 4 c sugar , flour , eggs , egg yolks , and milk, cook over medium low heat , stirring constantly , for 8-10 minutes or until it has thickened to the consistency of pudding, remove from heat and add vanilla, pour half of the vanilla cream filling over the bananas, layer 20 vanilla wafers on top of the filling, pour the remaining filling over the wafers, meringue: beat the egg whites on high speed with a mixer until foamy, add the sugar , 1 t at a time , and beat until stiff peaks form, spread the meringue evenly over the filling and be sure to seal the edges, bake at 350f for 10-12 minutes or until the meringue is golden brown, cool on a wire rack for 1 hour or until completely cool, coarsely crush the remaining 10 wafers and garnish the top of the pie, chill for 4 hours before serving
description: this is a delicious change from traditional banana pudding.  dont let the lengthy directions fool you cause this is really easy to prepare.  from southern living magazine.
ingredients: vanilla wafers, butter, bananas, sugar, all-purpose flour, eggs, egg yolks, milk, vanilla extract, egg whites

name: two ingredient biscuits
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, cuisine, preparation, north-american, 5-ingredients-or-less, breads, easy, vegetarian, rolls-biscuits, dietary
steps: preheat oven to 425f, in bowl blend the ingredients with a fork until mixed, do not over mix, you want it to just stick together, on a floured board roll out into 3 / 4 inch thick, cut biscuits with cutter approx 12 so use a 1 inch cutter, work the dough as little as possible, place on greased sheet and bake in top 3rd of the oven for 12 to 15 minutes, you want light brown, this dough is not forgiving of overworking, you can add ingredients such as cheese or herbs or sugar / cinnamon before baking
description: the original was from the pantry shelf by the indianapolis christian school
ingredients: self rising flour, sour cream

name: savory kucia   wheat berry salad
tags: time-to-make, preparation, occasion, taste-mood, savory, 4-hours-or-less
steps: rinse and drain the wheat berries, place them in a medium bowl , cover with water and soak overnight, drain the wheat berries , place in a medium saucepan , add 3 cups water and cook until the berries are soft and the water is pretty much absorbed , about 1 hour, if the berries are tender , you can just drain any excess water, cover the chopped onion with hot water for two or three minutes , and drain, place the cooked wheat in a large bowl and toss with the onion , apple , berries , poppy seeds and walnuts, add some freshly grated black pepper, whisk together the olive oil , vinegar , honey and salt, pour over the salad and toss to combine, let stand at least four hours or so , preferably overnight , to permit the flavors to meld, serve at room temperature, the heat and moisture of the cooked wheatberries will soften the dried berries , no need to presoak, if using dried cherries , you may want to cut them in half, i tend to use less salt than many , so you may want to adjust that to your own taste
description: one of the most important dishes for kucios, the lithuanian christmas eve supper, is "kucia", a mixture of wheat berries, ground poppy seeds and honey. ive never actually had this (wheat berries being scarce in california markets of 40 and 50 years ago), and since i prefer savory things, i decided to make a salad in the spirit of the traditional kucia, incorporating things that would have been available in a typical central/eastern european farmstead. ok, balsamic vinegar and olive oil are a bit of a stretch, but everything else would have been available at my grandparents farms. if youve never had wheat berries, youll discover a tasty grain. i have found that this tastes best if permitted to stand overnight, to permit the flavors to meld. cooking time does not include soaking or standing times.
ingredients: wheat berries, red onion, apple, mixed dried berries, walnuts, poppy seed, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey, salt, fresh ground pepper

name: baked red snapper greece
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, healthy, very-low-carbs, main-dish, seafood, greek, easy, european, dinner-party, holiday-event, fish, dietary, low-saturated-fat, low-calorie, high-protein, low-carb, high-in-something, low-in-something, saltwater-fish
steps: heat oven to 375 degrees f, lightly oil a shallow roasting pan, with sharp knife , make 4 cuts through skin of each fish, place snapper in oiled pan, drizzle , inside and out , with lemon juice , oil , and wine, sprinkle with salt and pepper, bake seasoned fish until cooked through , about 25 minutes total , or 10 minutes per each inch thickness, to serve , transfer fish to serving platter, garnish with thyme , if desired, serve immediately
description: easy to make! can be scaled up to serve a large group.  adapted from country living magazine, this is a typical recipe for fish from greece.
ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, red snapper, fresh lemon juice, dry white wine, coarse salt, white pepper, fresh thyme

name: apple banana cake
tags: weeknight, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, desserts, fruit, american, oven, vegetarian, cakes, dietary, comfort-food, apples, taste-mood, equipment, 4-hours-or-less
steps: preheat oven to 350 degrees f, combine all the wet ingredients in large bowl and mix well, combine dry ingredients in a separate bowl and mix well, add dry to wet ingredients and mix thoroughly, pour into an ungreased 9"x13" pan, bake for 1 hour
description: very moist, very delicious. the recipe was given to me by a friend.
ingredients: apples, bananas, vanilla, vegetable oil, eggs, walnuts, all-purpose flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, cinnamon

name: little bitty coffee hazelnut biscotti
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, cuisine, preparation, occasion, for-large-groups, 5-ingredients-or-less, desserts, oven, easy, european, cookies-and-brownies, italian, dietary, low-sodium, biscotti, low-in-something, equipment, number-of-servings
steps: heat oven to 375 degrees, line a cookie sheet with foil, beat eggs , sugar and coffee granules in a med, bowl with electric mixer until coffee granules dissolve and mixture is thick, fold in 1 / 2 cup flour , nuts and remaining 1 / 2 cup flour until well blended, spoon batter into a gallon size zipper-type plastic bag and snip off a corner to make a 1 / 2" wide opening, pipe nine 12" long strips crosswise 1" apart on prepared cookie sheet, bake 6-8 min, until strips look dry and spring back when lightly touched, do not brown, remove from oven, let cool on sheet 1-2 min, while still warm , peel 1 strip at a time from foil , place on a cutting board and with a serrated knife , cut diagonally into 20 slices, remove foil from cookie sheet, scatter slices over ungreased cookie sheet, bake 10-12 min, , turning slices once with a metal pancake turner , until dry and toasted, slide cookies onto countertop to cool completely, store loosely covered in a cool , dry place up to 1 month
description: originally from
ingredients: eggs, sugar, instant coffee, flour, hazelnuts

name: chilean pomegranate barbecue sauce   pomeque
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, for-large-groups, sauces, condiments-etc, savory-sauces, sweet-sauces, number-of-servings
steps: mix all ingredients thoroughly, pour into medium saucepan and bring slowly to a boil over medium-high heat , stirring frequently, reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered until slightly thickened , about 20 minutes, stir occasionally, mop sauce over grilled chicken or fish in the last 15 minutes of grilling
description: a fruity flavorful barbecue sauce perfect for chicken or fish...
ingredients: pomegranate juice, balsamic vinegar, honey, garlic, dried ginger, tomato paste

name: pumpkin scallop soup
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, soups-stews, seafood, vegetables, fall, winter, seasonal, scallops, shellfish, squash
steps: heat oil in dutch oven over medium-high heat, saute the garlic , celery , and onion until the onion is translucent, add flour and stir for a few minutes until roux is nice and golden, add stock and stir with a whisk until mixture begins to thicken, add remaining ingredients except the cream , salt , pepper , and scallops, simmer covered for 30 minutes , stirring often, add cream , salt , and pepper, add scallops and heat for about 4-5 minutes , make sure not to over cook the scallops !, serve immediately
description: this is a recipe i found and changed to fit my own personal tastes. this is great for autumn (since fresh pumpkin is so abundant) but is delightful any time of the year.
ingredients: olive oil, garlic clove, celery, onion, flour, chicken stock, allspice, worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, frozen squash, pumpkin, whipping cream, bay scallop, salt and pepper

name: yummy citrus cheesecake
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, desserts, cakes
steps: preheat oven to 350 degrees, in a bowl combine the cookie crumbs and the melted butter , press into the bottom of an ungreased 9 inch spring form pan, in a large bowl beat the cream cheese , sugar , vanilla and almond extract on medium speed until well blended, next add the juices and fruit zests and mix well, add your eggs , one at a time , just until blended and pour over crust, bake in a 350 degree oven for 45 - 50 minutes , or until centre is almost set, cool completely , then place in fridge overnight, when ready to serve , garnish with fresh berries
description:
i love cheesecakes, they are so yummy and really very easy to make. 

try it, your family will be so thrilled with it and best of all you will have made it from scratch.

you can change the cookie crumb on this recipe very easily to accomodate your personal taste preference.
ingredients: oreo cookie crumbs, butter, cream cheese, sugar, vanilla extract, almond extract, lemon juice, lime juice, orange juice, lemon zest, lime zest, orange zest, eggs

name: inside out sandwiches
tags: ham, 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, lunch, pork, easy, beginner-cook, kid-friendly, picnic, dietary, sandwiches, inexpensive, toddler-friendly, meat, to-go
steps: heat oven to 375, bake bread sticks as directed on package, cool, place lettuce on work surface, top each with a cheese slice & a ham slice, spread mayo over ham, place cooled bread stick in centre of each, wrap around and secure with toothpick
description: these are fun, easy, and really tasty.  they also allow for so many variations. recipe from pillsbury.
ingredients: refrigerated breadstick dough, lettuce leaves, baby swiss cheese, ham, mustard

name: snickerdoodles  the best
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, hand-formed-cookies, desserts, lunch, american, oven, easy, kid-friendly, cookies-and-brownies, dietary, gifts, equipment, number-of-servings
steps: heat the oven to 400f, next , in a large bowl , beat 1 1 / 2 cups sugar and margarine until light and fluffy, add vanilla and eggs and blend well, add flour , cream of tartar , baking soda , and salt , and mix well, mix 2 tbsp sugar and 2 tsp cinnamon in small bowl, shape the dough into balls and roll in the cinnamon-sugar mixture, place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet, bake at 400f for 7 to 9 minutes or until set, immediately remove from cookie sheets and cool completely
description: everyone i know loves these cookies. i took a batch to a party once and disappeared within 30 min. with people asking for more. i especially like the cinnamon and sugar. i must admit, it is not my creation; i got it from the pillsbury complete book of baking.
ingredients: sugar, margarine, vanilla, eggs, all-purpose flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, salt, cinnamon

name: chocolate double the milk shake recipe
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, for-1-or-2, healthy, 5-ingredients-or-less, beverages, breakfast, easy, low-fat, dietary, low-sodium, low-cholesterol, low-calorie, healthy-2, low-in-something, number-of-servings, 3-steps-or-less
steps: freeze an overripe banana , peeled and wrapped , 12 to 24 hours before making this shake, puree all the ingredients in a blender, serve immediately
description: we had skim chocolate milk in the house and my eldest daughter suggested that we try it in my double the milk shake recipe.  she makes these a lot in the morning, which makes mom happy because my growing girl needs her calcium!
ingredients: chocolate milk, nonfat dry milk powder, banana, ground cinnamon

name: martini red cabbage
tags: 60-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, cuisine, preparation, occasion, side-dishes, easy, european, fall, winter, seasonal, taste-mood, savory
steps: shred the cabbage, peel and slice the apple, melt the butter in a dutch oven or non-aluminum pot, add the cabbage and apple slices and mix, add the bay leaf , juniper berries and salt and pepper to taste, cover and cook over low heat for 10 minutes, mix in the dry vermouth , vinegar and sugar, cover and cook for 30 minutes, taste and adjust seasonings if necessary, goes well with pork or game dishes
description: this recipes name naturally when i substituted dry vermouth for dry white wine in my red cabbage recipe.
ingredients: red cabbage, tart apple, butter, bay leaf, juniper berries, dry vermouth, white vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper

name: lower east side lox
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, appetizers, eggs-dairy, seafood, vegetables, refrigerator, dips, salmon, fish, dietary, saltwater-fish, equipment
steps: beat the cream cheese to a smooth consistency and blend in the sour cream, mix in the lox thoroughly, stir in all of the other ingredients, cover and chill, suggested dippers: bagel chips , tomatoes , radishes , cucumber , scallions , and figs
description: an adopted recipe of mine which i havent made yet.
ingredients: cream cheese, sour cream, lox, fresh chives, white pepper, whipping cream, white onions

name: beach bread
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, for-1-or-2, appetizers, breads, american, easy, beginner-cook, holiday-event, grains, inexpensive, pasta-rice-and-grains, brunch, number-of-servings
steps: slice the bread in half lengthwise, butter lightly and put under broiler toast lightly, spread the blue cheese dressing equally over both halves, top with grated cheese and diced tomatoes, place under broiler until cheese melted
description: you could call this beach bruschetta.  an extremely popular appetizer when at fort myers beach.  so good.
ingredients: french bread, butter, blue cheese dressing, mozzarella cheese, diced tomatoes

name: fat free low fat vanilla milkshake
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, preparation, for-1-or-2, 5-ingredients-or-less, easy, dietary, free-of-something, number-of-servings, 3-steps-or-less
steps: in a blender , combine all ingredients and blend until smooth, you could also add in coffe syrup or chocolate syrup to change it up !
description: this is a vanilla milkshake that is so good, you wont believe its fat free!!
ingredients: non-fat vanilla frozen yogurt, vanilla extract, skim milk

name: garlic beef stroganoff
tags: course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, main-dish, beef, vegetables, american, easy, beginner-cook, crock-pot-slow-cooker, comfort-food, mushrooms, meat, steaks, onions, taste-mood, equipment, presentation, served-hot
steps: add water to reserved mushroom juice to equal 1 cup, in slow cooker dissolve beef bouillon in mushroom juice, add mushrooms , soup , onion , garlic and worcestershire sauce, saute beef in skillet until browned, add to slow cooker and stir to coat, cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours, when ready to serve cook noodles according to package directions, while noodles are cooking turn off heat to slow cooker, stir in cream cheese until melted and smooth, serve stroganoff over hot noodles, sprinkle with parsley if desired, enjoy !
description: i never have leftovers when making this recipe. it is a comforting dish for a cold winter night. serve with a side salad and possibly some bread and you have a complete meal.
ingredients: beef bouillon, mushrooms, 98% fat-free cream of mushroom soup, onion, garlic cloves, worcestershire sauce, round steaks, fat free cream cheese, whole wheat egg noodles

name: secret ingredient beef   veggie chili
tags: weeknight, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, main-dish, beans, beef, vegetables, american, southwestern-united-states, tex-mex, easy, beginner-cook, potluck, fall, winter, chili, crock-pot-slow-cooker, stove-top, dietary, spicy, seasonal, comfort-food, black-beans, ground-beef, meat, taste-mood, to-go, equipment, 4-hours-or-less
steps: brown ground beef in medium-hot skillet , adding some of the seasonings, while beef browns , sautee vegetables in separate pot on medium heat , adding 2 tsp of the beef drippings, when beef is fully cooked , drain if desired, stir crumbled cooked beef and remaining ingredients into the vegetables , reserving optional ingredients, cook uncovered on low heat for a few hours , stirring occasionally , until liquid reduces to desired consistency, adjust taste frequently using secret ingredients, enjoy with standard chili fare: cornbread , crusty bread , garlic bread , toast , baked potato , rice , etc
description: although it looks complicated, using canned goods makes this a quick recipe, and it can simmer in a crockpot. the veggies add interesting texture. but the fun part is tasting the chili as it cooks to figure out which of the secret ingredients it needs...it never turns out the same way twice!
ingredients: ground beef, zucchini, carrots, stewed tomatoes, chili bean, kidney bean, black beans, tomato paste, chili powder, garlic, salt and pepper, brewed coffee, red wine, tabasco sauce, vinegar, ketchup, cinnamon

name: cherry icebox cookies
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, desserts, cookies-and-brownies, grains, pasta-rice-and-grains, 4-hours-or-less
steps: beat butter at medium speed of an electric mixer until creamy, gradually add 1 cup sugar , beating well, add egg and vanilla , beating well, combine flour , baking powder , and salt, add to butter mixture , beating well, pat cherries between paper towels to remove excess moisture, stir cherries and pecans into dough, cover and chill 2 hours, shape dough into two 1 1 / 2"-diameter , 8"-long rolls, roll in colored sugar , if desired, wrap rolls in wax paper and freeze until firm, unwrap frozen dough and slice into 1 / 4"-thick slices , using a sharp knife, place on lightly greased cookie sheets, bake at 400 for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden, let cool 1 minute on cookie sheets, transfer to wire racks to cool completely
description: i made these and my husband pronounced them the best cookie ive ever made.  he also gave me the idea of sticking a kiss in them right after taking them out of the oven and calling it a chocolate covered cherry cookie.
ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, maraschino cherries, pecans, decorator sugar

name: vanilla creme    starbucks
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, for-1-or-2, beverages, easy, beginner-cook, kid-friendly, winter, dietary, seasonal, comfort-food, inexpensive, free-of-something, taste-mood, sweet, number-of-servings, presentation, served-hot
steps: place all ingredients in a medium pot , except for whip cream, stir well, allow to come to a boil , keeping a ever so watchful eye on it, once boil is acheive, pour into your favorite mugs, top off with whip cream, enjoy !
description: this recipe is my attempt to recreate starbucks version of vanilla creme, which is my favorite beside caramel macchiato.  this is a yummy tummy warming beverage, especially for curling up on the sofa and watching a good movie...or you could bring out those fancy biscottis and dip in the warm milk.this is a lowfat recipe that is high on flavor.measurements are approximate and allow for adding more or less to the recipe to achieve desired taste.
ingredients: low-fat milk, fat free french vanilla liquid coffee creamer, artificial vanilla flavoring, sugar, fat-free whipped topping

name: pierogies pot stickers with herbs and sour cream
tags: 15-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, occasion, lunch, side-dishes, snacks, easy, holiday-event, kid-friendly, vegetarian, dietary, superbowl, 3-steps-or-less
steps: cover the bottom of a skillet with softened butter, arrange pierogies in the pan in a single layer, add 1 cup water, cover pan and place over medium-high heat, cook , covered , 8 minutes, remove lid and cook out any remaining liquid, let the pierogies stick to the pan and brown in the butter as the liquid evaporates, remove crisp pierogies from heat and add chopped herbs and season with salt and pepper, turn to coat and serve with sour cream on the side, yum !
description: this recipe is taken from rachael rays "cooking round the clock" cookbook.  it turns the frozen pierogies you get at any grocery store into a fantastic, cripsy alternative to the usual soggy, boiled ones and makes a yummy snack or sidedish.  make these on game day and your guests will kiss the ground you walk on!  feel free to experiment with different herbs and spices - basil or crushed red pepper might be good.
ingredients: butter, frozen potato pierogi, water, salt and pepper, fresh dill, fresh chives, fresh flat-leaf parsley, sour cream

name: fat free lemon pie
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, preparation, healthy, pies-and-tarts, desserts, low-fat, pies, dietary, low-sodium, low-saturated-fat, low-calorie, low-in-something
steps: cook all ingredients in double boiler until thickened, pour into pie shell, top with meringue which has been beaten stiff, bake 450f for 15 minutes or until golden brown
description: a guilt free pie!
ingredients: water, sugar, cornstarch, eggs, lemon juice, egg whites, cream of tartar

name: mint ice cream
tags: time-to-make, course, preparation, desserts, frozen-desserts, dietary, low-sodium, low-in-something, equipment, small-appliance, 4-hours-or-less
steps: in a bowl , beat the sugar into the eggs until thickened and pale yellow, beat in the cornstarch and set aside, bring the half-and-half to a simmer in a saucepan, slowly beat the hot half-and-half into the egg mixture, pour the entire mixture back into the pan and place over low heat, stir constantly using a whisk or wooden spoon until the custard thickens slightly, remove from the heat and pour the hot custard through a strainer into a large , clean bowl, let the custard cool slightly , the stir in the cream , peppermint extract , and food coloring, cover and refrigerate until cold or overnight, stir the chilled custard , then freeze in 1 or 2 batches in an ice cream maker by following the manufacturers directions, when finished , the ice cream will be soft but ready to eat, for firmer ice cream , transfer to a freezer-safe container and freeze several hours, after-dinner mint ice cream: add cup chopped chocolate-covered mint candies to the machine when the ice cream is semifrozen, allow the machine to mix in the candy, proceed as directed, grasshopper pie ice cream: add cup white creme de cacao to the custard before freezing, proceed as directed , adding cup crushed chocolate wafers to the machine when the ice cream is semifrozen, allow the machine to mix in the wafers
description: delicious on its own or with dark chocolate chips.
ingredients: sugar, eggs, cornstarch, half-and-half, heavy cream, peppermint extract, green food coloring

name: boiled peanuts  bawld pnuts
tags: time-to-make, course, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, 5-ingredients-or-less, appetizers, lunch, snacks, american, southern-united-states, easy, beginner-cook, kid-friendly, dietary, low-sodium, comfort-food, high-protein, inexpensive, high-in-something, low-in-something, novelty, taste-mood, 4-hours-or-less
steps: fill pot with enough water so all peanuts are floating with room to sink, add salt to taste, add one or two splashes of white vinegar, bring to boil , reduce heat to low, boil for 1 hour , stirring occasionally, after boiling , let peanuts soak in brine for about 2 hours, some prefer to let finished peanuts sit in ziploc bags in refrigerator overnight
description: heres the best recipe for bawld peanuts i have ever found yall... got it from the piggly wiggly flyer lol - seriously.  they are the only ones ive found that actually taste like the roadside versions.  a little bit of cayenne would make these hawt bawld pnuts. now when i say salt to taste... the original called for 1/4 to 1/2 box of salt - i just pour a whole lotta in there and theyve always turned out.
ingredients: peanuts, salt, white vinegar

name: greek potato wedges
tags: weeknight, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, preparation, occasion, 5-ingredients-or-less, side-dishes, potatoes, vegetables, easy, potluck, dietary, comfort-food, taste-mood, to-go, 4-hours-or-less
steps: mix: 1 / 2 cup flour with the greek seasoning, dip potato wedges in melted margarine, coat with the flour and seasoning mixture, lay potatoes in 9x13-inch pan, put layer of onion slices over potatoes, sprinkle some of the greek seasoning over onions, put in 400 oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour
description: this is a wonderful side dish. we love it and i fix at least once a week.
ingredients: irish potatoes, margarine, flour, cavenders all purpose greek seasoning, onion

name: old fashion sour cream twists
tags: weeknight, time-to-make, course, preparation, breads, dietary, number-of-servings, 4-hours-or-less
steps: soften yeast in sour cream, add eggs , shortening , salt and vanilla, stir in flour, knead and chill two hours, mix together cinnamon and sugar, roll dough into a rectangle, sprinkle with 1 / 3 of sugar mixture, and fold into thirds, roll dough into rectangle , spinkle with remaining sugar mixture and fold again, cut folded dough into 1 / 4 inch slices, roll in granulated sugar , twist and press ends down on baking sheet, let rise 1 / 2 hour and bake at 375 for 12 to 15 minutes
description: this is a really old recipe - a lot of work by todays standards, but very worth it!
ingredients: yeast, sour cream, eggs, shortening, salt, vanilla, flour, granulated sugar, cinnamon

name: romano pork chops
tags: 30-minutes-or-less, time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north-american, main-dish, eggs-dairy, pork, canadian, easy, beginner-cook, dinner-party, holiday-event, kid-friendly, cheese, eggs, stove-top, dietary, spicy, comfort-food, high-protein, low-carb, british-columbian, high-in-something, low-in-something, meat, taste-mood, equipment
steps: trim fat from chops, one at a time , place chops between waxed paper and pound with a mallet to about 1 / 4 inch thick ,, on plate , mix together cheese , bread crumbs , cajun seasoning and lemon rind, spread flour on another plate, in shallow bowl , lightly beat eggs, coat each chop in flour , shaking off excess, dip into egg , then into crumb mixture to coat both sides, in a large frypan , heat oil over medium high heat, fry chops , in 2 batches and turning once , until golden brown , and crispy , about 6 minutes, garnish with lemon wedges
description: crunchy,spicy, delicious chops!! and quick too. adapted from canadian living mag.
ingredients: boneless pork chops, romano cheese, dry breadcrumbs, cajun seasoning, fresh lemon rind, all-purpose flour, eggs, vegetable oil, lemon wedge

name: spicy creamy coconut clay pot chicken
tags: time-to-make, course, main-ingredient, cuisine, preparation, casseroles, main-dish, fruit, poultry, asian, oven, nuts, stews, chicken, crock-pot-slow-cooker, coconut, meat, chicken-thighs-legs, equipment, 4-hours-or-less
